text: yes Sir

we are Luganodes, and looking into participating in  canton testnet.
We're requesting the following to finish onboarding onto Canton Testnet:
1. Which URL should we add to the SPONSOR_SV_URL environment variable? We see 2 URLs that seem appropriate:
• <https://scan.sv-1.test.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com> 
• <https://scan.sv-2.test.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>
2. Accordingly, could you please give us the ONBOARDING_SECRET for the respective URL?

text: from the identities dump

Welcome!

The Sponsor URL you should use is based on which Super Validator sponsored you to become a Validator. If you had no specific sponsor, I believe you should treat Global Synchronizer Foundation as your sponsor (not 100% sure on this, but I saw it mentioned in another thread), which would make your sponsor URL `<https://scan.sv-1.test.global.canton.network.sync.global>`

Your sponsor can provide you with a TestNet onboarding secret, but they are only valid for 48 hours, so make sure you're prepared and fully whitelisted before you request it.

Did a quick search and saw you were added to the channel on June 25th. Not sure how much of the above process you've already gone through, but the relevant documentation is here: <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_onboarding.html#onboarding-process-overview>

elements.text:

Your sponsor can provide you with a TestNet onboarding secret, but they are only valid for 48 hours, so make sure you're prepared and fully whitelisted before you request it.

Did a quick search and saw you were added to the channel on June 25th. Not sure how much of the above process you've already gone through, but the relevant documentation is here:

text:
Yesterday was a network reset. Did you do that?
<https://everstake-one.slack.com/archives/C08AP9QR7K4/p1751418336943159>

elements.text:
DEVNET RESET
Update and Details

Wednesday, 2nd July

Validators should plan to join DevNet when the Super Validators announce that DevNet is ready for joining, which will be soon after 9 am US Eastern / 13:00 UTC.

Understanding the reset:

A DevNet Reset takes place when one Super Validator takes down its DevNet node, and starts a new synchronizer with Migration_ID 0 and a new chain id suffix, then invites other Super Validators to join the new synchronizer.  The Super Validators do this to clean up DevNet (which tends to accumulate dead Validator nodes) and reduce the cost of maintaining it.

For this DevNet reset, Digital Asset has informed the other Super Validators that DA will take down all of its DevNet Super Validator nodes Wednesday morning Zurich time, and have a new DevNet ready a few hours later. Then the other Super Validators add to that new DevNet synchronizer. Validators can begin to join soon after.

To give DA plenty of time to complete this, they've shifted the announcement time to 9:00 am US Eastern / 13:00 UTC, rather than 10:00 UTC as previously announced. Other Super Validators will join into the new DevNet starting around 9 am, and an announcement will go out in this channel once the Super Validators conclude that the new DevNet is ready for Validators to join. This will be soon after 9:00 am US Eastern.

Validators are free to join the new DevNet throughout the next few days. It's a good idea to complete this process before Monday 7th July, so your DevNet node is ready for the next upgrade.

ACTIONS REQUIRED
Follow the reset procedure documented at
Double check that all persistent storage was fully wiped before you onboarded the new validator, as reusing data from before the reset might break your validator

DEVNET RESET
Update and Details

Wednesday, 2nd July

Validators should plan to join DevNet when the Super Validators announce that DevNet is ready for joining, which will be soon after 9 am US Eastern / 13:00 UTC.

Understanding the reset:

A DevNet Reset takes place when one Super Validator takes down its DevNet node, and starts a new synchronizer with Migration_ID 0 and a new chain id suffix, then invites other Super Validators to join the new synchronizer.  The Super Validators do this to clean up DevNet (which tends to accumulate dead Validator nodes) and reduce the cost of maintaining it.

For this DevNet reset, Digital Asset has informed the other Super Validators that DA will take down all of its DevNet Super Validator nodes Wednesday morning Zurich time, and have a new DevNet ready a few hours later. Then the other Super Validators add to that new DevNet synchronizer. Validators can begin to join soon after.

To give DA plenty of time to complete this, they've shifted the announcement time to 9:00 am US Eastern / 13:00 UTC, rather than 10:00 UTC as previously announced. Other Super Validators will join into the new DevNet starting around 9 am, and an announcement will go out in this channel once the Super Validators conclude that the new DevNet is ready for Validators to join. This will be soon after 9:00 am US Eastern.

Validators are free to join the new DevNet throughout the next few days. It's a good idea to complete this process before Monday 7th July, so your DevNet node is ready for the next upgrade.

ACTIONS REQUIRED
• After the reset
    ◦ Follow the reset procedure documented at <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_network_resets.html>
    ◦ Double check that all persistent storage was fully wiped before you onboarded the new validator, as reusing data from before the reset might break your validator
attachments.text:
<!here>
DEVNET RESET
Update and Details

Wednesday, 2nd July

Validators should plan to join DevNet when the Super Validators announce that DevNet is ready for joining, which will be soon after 9 am US Eastern / 13:00 UTC.

Understanding the reset:

A DevNet Reset takes place when one Super Validator takes down its DevNet node, and starts a new synchronizer with Migration_ID 0 and a new chain id suffix, then invites other Super Validators to join the new synchronizer.  The Super Validators do this to clean up DevNet (which tends to accumulate dead Validator nodes) and reduce the cost of maintaining it.

For this DevNet reset, Digital Asset has informed the other Super Validators that DA will take down all of its DevNet Super Validator nodes Wednesday morning Zurich time, and have a new DevNet ready a few hours later. Then the other Super Validators add to that new DevNet synchronizer. Validators can begin to join soon after.

To give DA plenty of time to complete this, they've shifted the announcement time to 9:00 am US Eastern / 13:00 UTC, rather than 10:00 UTC as previously announced. Other Super Validators will join into the new DevNet starting around 9 am, and an announcement will go out in this channel once the Super Validators conclude that the new DevNet is ready for Validators to join. This will be soon after 9:00 am US Eastern.

Validators are free to join the new DevNet throughout the next few days. It's a good idea to complete this process before Monday 7th July, so your DevNet node is ready for the next upgrade.

ACTIONS REQUIRED
• After the reset
    ◦ Follow the reset procedure documented at <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_network_resets.html>
    ◦ Double check that all persistent storage was fully wiped before you onboarded the new validator, as reusing data from before the reset might break your validator

```# request new secret
curl -sX POST <https://sv.sv-1.dev.global.canton.network.sync.global/api/sv/v0/devnet/onboard/validator/prepare> > secret


export IMAGE_TAG=0.4.3
MIGRATION=0
SPONSOR_URL=<https://sv.sv-1.dev.global.canton.network.sync.global>
SECRET=`cat secret`

./start.sh -s "$SPONSOR_URL" -o "$SECRET" -p "<validator-party-hint>" -m "$MIGRATION" -w -a```

text:
hi, we've just been approved to be validator operator, try to deploy a validator with docker composer, just go throught <https://docs.sync.global/>. And I plan to deploy by steps below:

1. apply for an EC2 in aws : 4 core 16 GB RAM
2. sumbit the ip here and wait for whitelist
3. request a onboarding secret
3. download the bundle and run scripts
4. authentication setup

are these steps correct?
and I still have some more questions:
1. is 4 core 16 GB RAM enough, what's the storage requirement?
2. should I start with DevNet or MainNet? How to "jump" from DevNet to MainNet, just replace the MIGRATION_ID?
3. about the ip white list and onboard secret, it says in the doc I should ask YOUR_SV_SPONSOR, but I'm not sure what that is, we applied in <https://sync.global/validator-request/>, so the YOUR_SV_SPONSOR should be the Global Synchronizer Foundation?

text:
Pay attention on what you paste in your terminal, mate.
`Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: non expected character 0x3c in Daml-LF Party "<validator-party-hint>"`
^ `<validator-party-hint>` is actually needed to be replaced with your validator hint. Check the documentation, it should be something like "orgname-type-index"

text: Hi, We are trying to understand how app rewards work. Like canton rewards, should we expect them on the validator party hint, or will we get the rewards on the wallet where credential offer was accepted? Does the interval of getting rewards depend on different apps or is there a fixed interval?
